name: Quartermaster Mayes

topics.topic_text: Want to play a hand of Caravan?
topics.response_text: Damn straight I would! Let's see what you got.

topics.topic_text: CaravanPlayerLoses
topics.response_text: That was too easy. How about we play again and this time you actually try.

topics.topic_text: CaravanPlayerWins
topics.response_text: Dammit. I should have won that match. Let's play again.

topics.topic_text: I'm all done playing for now.
topics.response_text: I'll be here if you ever want a rematch.

topics.topic_text: Yeah, let's play again.
topics.response_text: I hope you're ready for this.

topics.topic_text: GREETING
topics.response_text: So I heard you helped take over Nelson from the Legion. Glad to see someone making a difference around here instead of just complaining.

topics.topic_text: Major Polatli sent me to help you out.
topics.response_text: So the Major has you running errands for him. Well, we're short on personnel as well as supplies so we'll take all the help we can get.

topics.topic_text: How're things around the camp?
topics.response_text: Not good. If we don't get more supplies, we're going to have to start using dirt for food and sticks and rocks for weapons.

topics.topic_text: [PRESS DEMO] I'll look for your men and supplies. Send me to HELIOS One.
topics.response_text: Thanks. Watch your back out there. Never know when those Legion bastards might show up.

topics.topic_text: A little morbid, isn't it?
topics.response_text: Maybe, but the situation around here calls for it. You gonna help or not?

topics.topic_text: I found the supplies you were looking for.
topics.response_text: I take it my men were dead. It's a high price to pay, but these supplies will save a few lives here.

topics.topic_text: Speaking of supplies... I found some nearby, are they yours?
topics.response_text: Damn it all... I sent some men out to get these supplies, but they never returned. I guess the Legion got them on their way back.

topics.topic_text: Tell me about yourself.
topics.response_text: Me? I've been doing this shit for far too long and have been in too many battles to remember.

topics.topic_text: About that thing you wanted...
topics.response_text: Have you changed your mind? Are you willing to help me out with something real simple?

topics.topic_text: I'm always willing to give a helping hand.
topics.response_text: I want you to collect NCR dogtags from our fallen troopers. That way I can keep track of who's gone and how to reallocate our supplies.

topics.topic_text: Uh, no thanks, maybe later.
topics.response_text: Suit yourself. Let me know if you change your mind.

topics.topic_text: I found some NCR dogtags.
topics.response_text: Hey, you've been a big help. I wanted to give you something for helping me out. It's not much, but here you go.

topics.topic_text: Seems easy enough.
topics.response_text: It's easy. Just bring back any NCR dogtags you find and I'll try to make it worth your while.

topics.topic_text: I wanted to ask about your missing men.
topics.response_text: What do you want to know?

topics.topic_text: The situation looks pretty bad here.
topics.response_text: Bad? I've been doing this a long time and I haven't been in many places that were worse than this.

topics.topic_text: Quit complaining, it's not that bad here.
topics.response_text: Is that a joke? Have you looked around? Massive casualties, constant raids, barely any food or equipment... does that sound alright to you?

topics.topic_text: How can I help with your supply problems?
topics.response_text: The Major let me send out some troops to gather supplies, but unfortunately they never returned. I'm guessing they ran into some trouble on the way.

topics.topic_text: Any idea on where I should start looking?
topics.response_text: I sent them to HELIOS One to see if they had any supplies they could spare. They've got to be somewhere between here and there.

topics.topic_text: This sounds pretty dangerous.
topics.response_text: It's dangerous, but not as bad now that we've taken back Nelson from the Legion.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to ask about something else.
topics.response_text: Make it quick, I don't have time to stand around talking all day long.

topics.topic_text: Goodbye.
topics.response_text: We really need those supplies, so don't take your sweet time finding them.

topics.topic_text: Do you know anything about Dr. Richards' missing medical supplies?
topics.response_text: No, can't say I do. I've got my own problems to worry about.

topics.topic_text: I'd like to trade.
topics.response_text: I don't have any supplies to spare, but I've got caps if you have anything you don't need.

topics.topic_text: Thanks, I appreciate it.
topics.response_text: You're welcome. Enjoy.

topics.topic_text: Whatever it is, I think you need it more than I do.
topics.response_text: I'm not going to argue with you there. Thanks, I appreciate this.

description:
Carl Mayes is a 45 year-old African American Male.

A middle-aged African American NCR officer serving as the quartermaster at Camp Forlorn Hope. His weathered face and tired eyes speak of years of service in the harsh Mojave Wasteland. He can typically be found in his tent across from the storage shed, meticulously organizing supplies.

Carl Mayes's Personality: Dedicated, pragmatic, and loyal to the NCR despite the difficult circumstances. Mayes is resourceful and willing to accept help from outsiders when necessary, though he maintains military formality in his interactions. He carries himself with the weight of responsibility for his unit's survival.

Carl Mayes's Backstory: Carl Mayes has served in the New California Republic Army for over twenty years, seeing postings across the former United States. He's weathered numerous conflicts and resource shortages, but considers his current assignment at Camp Forlorn Hope the most challenging of his career. A seasoned quartermaster, he has a reputation for making the most of limited resources, but the recent Legion threat and loss of personnel have stretched his capabilities to their limits.
